docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: Complete installation guide for LocalPro Super App Backend.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Node.js: v18.x or higher
  • MongoDB: v6.0 or higher
  • npm: v9.x or higher
  • Git: Latest version

docs.title: Quick Installation
docs.text:
# 1. Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/your-org/localpro-super-app.git
cd localpro-super-app

# 2. Install dependencies
npm install

# 3. Configure environment
cp env.example .env
# Edit .env with your settings

# 4. Run setup
npm run setup

# 5. Start development server
npm run dev

docs.title: 1. Install Node.js
docs.text:
Download and install Node.js from nodejs.org.

Verify installation: 

node --version  # Should be v18.x or higher
npm --version   # Should be v9.x or higher

docs.title: Option A: Local Installation
docs.text: Download from mongodb.com.

docs.title: Option B: MongoDB Atlas (Cloud)
docs.text:
1. Sign up at mongodb.com/cloud/atlas
  2. Create a free cluster
  3. Get connection string

docs.title: 3. Clone Repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/your-org/localpro-super-app.git
cd localpro-super-app

docs.title: 4. Install Dependencies
docs.text: npm install

docs.title: 5. Configure Environment
docs.text:
cp env.example .env

Edit .env with your configuration:

# Required
MONGODB_URI=mongodb://localhost:27017/localpro-super-app
JWT_SECRET=your-super-secret-jwt-key-here

# Optional (for development)
NODE_ENV=development
PORT=5000

docs.title: 6. Run Setup Script
docs.text:
npm run setup

This will: - ✅ Connect to MongoDB - ✅ Create database indexes - ✅ Create default app settings - ✅ Create admin users - ✅ Seed sample data

docs.title: 7. Start Server
docs.text:
# Development mode (with auto-reload)
npm run dev

# Production mode
npm start

Server will start on http://localhost:5000

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
1. Check server status: 

    curl http://localhost:5000/health

  2. Test API: 

    curl http://localhost:5000/api/health

  3. Access Swagger docs (if configured): 

    http://localhost:5000/api-docs

docs.title: MongoDB Connection Issues
docs.text:
# Check MongoDB is running
mongosh

# Or check service status
# Windows
net start MongoDB

# Linux/Mac
sudo systemctl status mongod

docs.title: Port Already in Use
docs.text:
# Change port in .env
PORT=5001

docs.title: Permission Errors
docs.text:
# Linux/Mac: Use sudo if needed
sudo npm install

# Or fix permissions
sudo chown -R $USER:$USER .
